Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Little Abbie who was 3 years old. Little Abbie loved to play outside and often went to the park by herself.

were so tasty and delicious!
After lunch, Emily and her family would spend the rest of the afternoon together. They would play lots of games and Emily would explore her garden and look for bugs. She loved spending time with her family and she always felt so happy and content.
When Sunday evening came, Emily would thank her family for spending the day together. She always loved Sunday and everything it brought. Even though it was so sad to say goodbye each week, Emily felt that every Sunday was sweet and special in its own way!

named Lily. She had a big red ball that she loved to play with. One day, while playing outside, her ball rolled away and got stuck in a tree.
A tall boy named Tom saw Lily was sad. He wanted to help her. Tom offered to get the ball for her. He reached up high and got the ball out of the tree. Lily was so grateful to Tom for his help.
After that, Lily and Tom became best friends. They played with the red ball every day. They were always happy and grateful to have each other. And they always remembered to help others when they could.

ophie ate the nut and then the squirrel said: "I have a surprise for you". The squirrel jumped back to the ground and gave Sophie a piece of cut grass. It said: "this piece of grass will help you make a bed for your hut."
Sophie thanked the squirrel and thanked it for its playful gifts. The squirrel nodded and said: "it was my pleasure". The squirrel waved goodbye and soon afterwards, Sophie was back in her hut, content and warm.

Max's family talked to a lady at the airport. "We are going on a big plane," said Max's mom. Max wagged his tail and looked at the planes. He wanted to go on one too.

ball for Max. She threw the ball far away from the bush, and Max ran after it.
Max was very grateful to Lisa for helping him get the ball. He wagged his tail and barked happily. Lisa smiled and played with Max for a while. They had a lot of fun together. From that day on, Max and Lisa became best friends, and they played in the park every day. And Max was never scared of the bush again, because he knew Lisa would always be there to help him.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful car named Carl. Carl loved to drive around with his friends. One day, Carl noticed he was low on fuel. He needed to buy more fuel so he could keep playing with his friends.
Carl went to the fuel store with his friend, Timmy the Truck. Timmy said, "Carl, let's buy fuel together!" Carl was happy to have his friend's help. They went inside the store and bought the fuel they needed.

That night, Abby had a dream. She dreamt that Benny was really angry at her for being so selfish. She kept hearing his voice saying, "Abby, you need to behave better".
The next day, Abby met Benny again and remembered her dream. She decided she would not be selfish anymore and decided to share the silver coin with her best friend. When Benny saw the coin he was so surprised, he said, "Thank you Abby!"
The two friends hugged each other and laughed. They both knew that behaving better was always the right thing to do.
